conclusion: Analyze the motion of the electron in the electric field using given velocity components.
Determine horizontal component of velocity at point C: v_x = v_0 = 4 x 10^6 m/s.
Calculate vertical component of velocity at point C using angle 30 degrees: v_y = 4 x 10^6 / sqrt(3) ≈ 2.309 x 10^6 m/s.
Calculate total velocity at point C: v = sqrt((4 x 10^6)^2 + (4 x 10^6 / sqrt(3))^2) ≈ 4.619 x 10^6 m/s.
Calculate kinetic energy at point C: K = 1/2 x 0.91 x 10^-30 x (8 x 10^6 / sqrt(3))^2 ≈ 9.72 x 10^-18 J.
Final answer: Kinetic energy of electron at point C is 9.72 x 10^-18 J.
